Class Registers

java.lang.Object
  Registers
public class Registers
extends java.lang.Object

Provides access to the general and special-purpose registers.

Version:
$Revision: 1.3 $
Author:
C. Vickery

Method Summary

          Returns the current value of a register.

          Assigns a new value to a register, and updates the simulator's count of clock cycles.

clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

setValue

static void setValue(int regNo,
                     int Value)
Assigns a new value to a register, and updates the simulator's count of clock cycles. Some register gets assigned a value on every tick of the CPU clock, although values to r0 are discarded. Thus, the simulator is cycle-accurate provided every ALU or Memory result is saved in a register. Outputs a message telling what register changed value if Simulator.logRegs is true.

Parameters:
regNo - The register to be updated.
Value - The value to be stored into it.

getValue

static int getValue(int regNo)
Returns the current value of a register.

Parameters:
regNo - The register to be read from.
Returns:
The current contents of the register.
